selected_quotes: New study in #Nature finds people w/ #ASD 20% more likely to have #copynumbervariations. #Autism
By combining prior autism literature, researchers have identified 30 candidate #genes that could cause #autism.

citation.title: Haplotype structure enables prioritization of common markers and candidate genes in autism spectrum disorder

facebook.title: Translational Psychiatry - Haplotype structure enables prioritization of common markers and...
facebook.summary: A new study using families from the Autism Genetic Resource Exchange (AGRE) finds that individuals with autism are 20% more likely to have copy-number variations of specific genes.

facebook.summary: This is very difficult to understand, and I'm not sure I truly get it, but by combining prior autism literature, researchers have identified 30 candidate genes that could cause autism. We are making great strides in understanding the genetic contributions
